pull.title: contrib: simplify `test-security-check`
pull.body: The current `test-security-check` script is hard to understand, and change (i.e https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29987/files#diff-52aa0cda44721f089e53b128cb1232a876006ef257b211655456b17dfb2ec712); tests are also not done in isolation (when-possible). Fix that, and add missing checks. Simplifies future toolchain/security/hardening changes.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage
For detailed information about the code coverage, see the [test coverage report](https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/30423).
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| Concept ACK | [hebasto](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30423#pullrequestreview-2171924002) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with 👎 to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#30387](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30387) (contrib: use c++ compiler rather than c compiler for binary checks by theuni)
* [#27038](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27038) (security-check: test for `_FORTIFY_SOURCE` usage in release binaries by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

> tests are also not done in isolation (when-possible).

Mind elaborating this statement please? I mean, `contrib/devtools/test-security-check.py` is supposed to run in the Guix environment. So what kind of "isolation" do you mean?

> So what kind of "isolation" do you mean?

Testing one thing per test.

Concept ACK.

nit: Spaces after commas and around `+` can used more consistently for better readability.

tree 7c0bd865930d9ebf02cca8e470a33476b5ade65f
parent 9b480f7a25a737c9c4ebc33401e94d66c2da9ec3

contrib: simplify MACHO test-security-check

tree 547da3c0756103f3253f0f0a116bdd2d0fb3f34b
parent 41b266c3407a1f3fe51e2a01149bafb0a565b036

contrib: simplify PE test-security-check

tree 13b52a7cb5c0b9564c5377d68dba2de24dd1e8f0
parent 0a6d65b48ff96cf8f82d0609d1b99518d032a47a
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1720625834 +0100
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1720707447 +0100

contrib: simplify ELF test-security-check

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -95,20 +82,15 @@ def test_PE(self):
         cc = determine_wellknown_cmd('CC', 'x86_64-w64-mingw32-gcc')
         write_testcode(source)
 
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--disable-nxcompat','-Wl,--disable-reloc-section','-Wl,--disable-dynamicbase','-Wl,--disable-high-entropy-va','-no-pie','-fno-PIE','-fno-stack-protector']),
-            (1, executable+': failed PIE DYNAMIC_BASE HIGH_ENTROPY_VA NX RELOC_SECTION CONTROL_FLOW Canary'))
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--disable-reloc-section','-Wl,--disable-dynamicbase','-Wl,--disable-high-entropy-va','-no-pie','-fno-PIE','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']),
-            (1, executable+': failed PIE DYNAMIC_BASE HIGH_ENTROPY_VA RELOC_SECTION CONTROL_FLOW'))
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--enable-reloc-section','-Wl,--disable-dynamicbase','-Wl,--disable-high-entropy-va','-no-pie','-fno-PIE','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']),
-            (1, executable+': failed PIE DYNAMIC_BASE HIGH_ENTROPY_VA CONTROL_FLOW'))
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--enable-reloc-section','-Wl,--disable-dynamicbase','-Wl,--disable-high-entropy-va','-pie','-fPIE','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']),
-            (1, executable+': failed PIE DYNAMIC_BASE HIGH_ENTROPY_VA CONTROL_FLOW'))  # -pie -fPIE does nothing unless --dynamicbase is also supplied
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--enable-reloc-section','-Wl,--dynamicbase','-Wl,--disable-high-entropy-va','-pie','-fPIE','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']),
-            (1, executable+': failed HIGH_ENTROPY_VA CONTROL_FLOW'))
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--enable-reloc-section','-Wl,--dynamicbase','-Wl,--high-entropy-va','-pie','-fPIE','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']),
-            (1, executable+': failed CONTROL_FLOW'))
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--enable-reloc-section','-Wl,--dynamicbase','-Wl,--high-entropy-va','-pie','-fPIE', '-fcf-protection=full','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']),
-            (0, ''))
+        pass_flags = ['-pie','-fPIE', '-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--enable-reloc-section','-Wl,--dynamicbase','-Wl,--high-entropy-va', '-fcf-protection=full','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']
comments.body:
Is the `-pie` flag supported here?

From the `ld` linker [docs](https://sourceware.org/binutils/docs/ld.html#index-_002dpie):
> This is currently only supported on ELF platforms.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -95,20 +82,15 @@ def test_PE(self):
         cc = determine_wellknown_cmd('CC', 'x86_64-w64-mingw32-gcc')
         write_testcode(source)
 
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--disable-nxcompat','-Wl,--disable-reloc-section','-Wl,--disable-dynamicbase','-Wl,--disable-high-entropy-va','-no-pie','-fno-PIE','-fno-stack-protector']),
-            (1, executable+': failed PIE DYNAMIC_BASE HIGH_ENTROPY_VA NX RELOC_SECTION CONTROL_FLOW Canary'))
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--disable-reloc-section','-Wl,--disable-dynamicbase','-Wl,--disable-high-entropy-va','-no-pie','-fno-PIE','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']),
-            (1, executable+': failed PIE DYNAMIC_BASE HIGH_ENTROPY_VA RELOC_SECTION CONTROL_FLOW'))
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--enable-reloc-section','-Wl,--disable-dynamicbase','-Wl,--disable-high-entropy-va','-no-pie','-fno-PIE','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']),
-            (1, executable+': failed PIE DYNAMIC_BASE HIGH_ENTROPY_VA CONTROL_FLOW'))
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--enable-reloc-section','-Wl,--disable-dynamicbase','-Wl,--disable-high-entropy-va','-pie','-fPIE','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']),
-            (1, executable+': failed PIE DYNAMIC_BASE HIGH_ENTROPY_VA CONTROL_FLOW'))  # -pie -fPIE does nothing unless --dynamicbase is also supplied
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--enable-reloc-section','-Wl,--dynamicbase','-Wl,--disable-high-entropy-va','-pie','-fPIE','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']),
-            (1, executable+': failed HIGH_ENTROPY_VA CONTROL_FLOW'))
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--enable-reloc-section','-Wl,--dynamicbase','-Wl,--high-entropy-va','-pie','-fPIE','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']),
-            (1, executable+': failed CONTROL_FLOW'))
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--enable-reloc-section','-Wl,--dynamicbase','-Wl,--high-entropy-va','-pie','-fPIE', '-fcf-protection=full','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']),
-            (0, ''))
+        pass_flags = ['-pie','-fPIE', '-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--enable-reloc-section','-Wl,--dynamicbase','-Wl,--high-entropy-va', '-fcf-protection=full','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']
+
+        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, pass_flags + ['-fno-stack-protector']), (1, executable+': failed Canary'))
+        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, pass_flags + ['-Wl,--disable-reloc-section']), (1, executable+': failed RELOC_SECTION'))
comments.body:
This check fails:
```
FAIL: test_PE (__main__.TestSecurityChecks)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/distsrc-base/distsrc-ea096063c384-x86_64-w64-mingw32/./contrib/devtools/test-security-check.py", line 88, in test_PE
    self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, pass_flags + ['-Wl,--disable-reloc-section']), (1, executable+': failed RELOC_SECTION'))
AssertionError: Tuples differ: (1, 'test1.exe: failed PIE DYNAMIC_BASE HIGH_ENTROPY_VA') != (1, 'test1.exe: failed RELOC_SECTION')

First differing element 1:
'test1.exe: failed PIE DYNAMIC_BASE HIGH_ENTROPY_VA'
'test1.exe: failed RELOC_SECTION'

- (1, 'test1.exe: failed PIE DYNAMIC_BASE HIGH_ENTROPY_VA')
+ (1, 'test1.exe: failed RELOC_SECTION')

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 1 test in 0.181s

FAILED (failures=1)
make: *** [Makefile:1348: test-security-check] Error 1
```

         cc = determine_wellknown_cmd('CC', 'x86_64-w64-mingw32-gcc')
         write_testcode(source)
 
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--disable-nxcompat','-Wl,--disable-reloc-section','-Wl,--disable-dynamicbase','-Wl,--disable-high-entropy-va','-no-pie','-fno-PIE','-fno-stack-protector']),
-            (1, executable+': failed PIE DYNAMIC_BASE HIGH_ENTROPY_VA NX RELOC_SECTION CONTROL_FLOW Canary'))
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--disable-reloc-section','-Wl,--disable-dynamicbase','-Wl,--disable-high-entropy-va','-no-pie','-fno-PIE','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']),
-            (1, executable+': failed PIE DYNAMIC_BASE HIGH_ENTROPY_VA RELOC_SECTION CONTROL_FLOW'))
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--enable-reloc-section','-Wl,--disable-dynamicbase','-Wl,--disable-high-entropy-va','-no-pie','-fno-PIE','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']),
-            (1, executable+': failed PIE DYNAMIC_BASE HIGH_ENTROPY_VA CONTROL_FLOW'))
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--enable-reloc-section','-Wl,--disable-dynamicbase','-Wl,--disable-high-entropy-va','-pie','-fPIE','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']),
-            (1, executable+': failed PIE DYNAMIC_BASE HIGH_ENTROPY_VA CONTROL_FLOW'))  # -pie -fPIE does nothing unless --dynamicbase is also supplied
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--enable-reloc-section','-Wl,--dynamicbase','-Wl,--disable-high-entropy-va','-pie','-fPIE','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']),
-            (1, executable+': failed HIGH_ENTROPY_VA CONTROL_FLOW'))
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--enable-reloc-section','-Wl,--dynamicbase','-Wl,--high-entropy-va','-pie','-fPIE','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']),
-            (1, executable+': failed CONTROL_FLOW'))
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--enable-reloc-section','-Wl,--dynamicbase','-Wl,--high-entropy-va','-pie','-fPIE', '-fcf-protection=full','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']),

comments.body:
Those look like the wrong docs:
```bash
x86_64-w64-mingw32-ld --help | grep pie
  -pie, --pic-executable      Create a position independent executable
  -no-pie                     Create a position dependent executable (default)
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -95,20 +82,15 @@ def test_PE(self):
         cc = determine_wellknown_cmd('CC', 'x86_64-w64-mingw32-gcc')
         write_testcode(source)
 
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--disable-nxcompat','-Wl,--disable-reloc-section','-Wl,--disable-dynamicbase','-Wl,--disable-high-entropy-va','-no-pie','-fno-PIE','-fno-stack-protector']),
-            (1, executable+': failed PIE DYNAMIC_BASE HIGH_ENTROPY_VA NX RELOC_SECTION CONTROL_FLOW Canary'))
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--disable-reloc-section','-Wl,--disable-dynamicbase','-Wl,--disable-high-entropy-va','-no-pie','-fno-PIE','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']),
-            (1, executable+': failed PIE DYNAMIC_BASE HIGH_ENTROPY_VA RELOC_SECTION CONTROL_FLOW'))
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--enable-reloc-section','-Wl,--disable-dynamicbase','-Wl,--disable-high-entropy-va','-no-pie','-fno-PIE','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']),
-            (1, executable+': failed PIE DYNAMIC_BASE HIGH_ENTROPY_VA CONTROL_FLOW'))
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--enable-reloc-section','-Wl,--disable-dynamicbase','-Wl,--disable-high-entropy-va','-pie','-fPIE','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']),
-            (1, executable+': failed PIE DYNAMIC_BASE HIGH_ENTROPY_VA CONTROL_FLOW'))  # -pie -fPIE does nothing unless --dynamicbase is also supplied
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--enable-reloc-section','-Wl,--dynamicbase','-Wl,--disable-high-entropy-va','-pie','-fPIE','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']),
-            (1, executable+': failed HIGH_ENTROPY_VA CONTROL_FLOW'))
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--enable-reloc-section','-Wl,--dynamicbase','-Wl,--high-entropy-va','-pie','-fPIE','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']),
-            (1, executable+': failed CONTROL_FLOW'))
-        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, ['-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--enable-reloc-section','-Wl,--dynamicbase','-Wl,--high-entropy-va','-pie','-fPIE', '-fcf-protection=full','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']),
-            (0, ''))
+        pass_flags = ['-pie','-fPIE', '-Wl,--nxcompat','-Wl,--enable-reloc-section','-Wl,--dynamicbase','-Wl,--high-entropy-va', '-fcf-protection=full','-fstack-protector-all', '-lssp']
+
+        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, pass_flags + ['-fno-stack-protector']), (1, executable+': failed Canary'))
+        self.assertEqual(call_security_check(cc, source, executable, pass_flags + ['-Wl,--disable-reloc-section']), (1, executable+': failed RELOC_SECTION'))
comments.body: This has turned up what looks like a bug in LIEF: https://github.com/lief-project/LIEF/issues/1076. Will re-enable the test later.
